fields.summary: Document update - HP SUM failure handling guideline in Elem_mgr firmware automation admin guide
fields.Issue Description:
1 &; T R O U B L E &; E F F E C T
&;

1.1. Technical problem and/or commercial effect
-
Document update - "Firmware Upgrade Automation Guide for Elem_mgr Deployment"

Firmware upgrade automation guide doesn"t say about HP SUM (Software update management) tool which our firmware
automation framework uses and if any failure encountered and f/w install failed because of SUM then how to handle those failures?
Whether one has to contact a_company design or CU or MA has to secure SUM failure support via their own HP contract.

Expectation is to write a draft or guidelines around this situation (and more based on design experience) so that end user or Elem_mgr administrator&;
have a guideline to follow when it comes to firmware failures due to HP SUM component.
At present this seems missing in&;firmware upgrade automation guide for Elem_mgr deployment&;

-
1.2. System impact
-
Elem_mgr system firmware upgrade blocked&;

-
1.3. Conditions
-
Firmware upgrade failed due to HP SUM component&;

2 &; T R O U B L E &; D E S C R I P T I O N
&;
-
2.1. Found in version
-
Elem_mgr 24.2&;

-
2.2. Service Management System Customer Service Request Id (SMS CSR Id)
-
STA-00330150

-
2.3. Service Steps to Reproduce Fault (Mandatory)
-
Execute firmware upgrade via firmware upgrade automation framework (with limited admin previleages) to get HP SUM exceptions

-
2.4. Customer information
-
Reliance JIO India&;
&;
-
2.5. Configuration data
-
NA
&;
-
2.6. Tracing and log files&;
-
Pls refer support JIRA - 746910 for detailed analysis/feedback/inputs&;
HP case id - 5383835349
-
2.7. Frequency of fault
-
Always

3 &; M E A S U R E S
&;
-
3.1. Recovery

NA

-
3.2. Workaround
-
NA

fields.Resolution Details:
A note was added in the troubleshooting section of Firmware upgrade automation guide, to reach 
out HPE by logging a support case with all the issue details,if any firmware upgrade activity failed due to SUM tool.

fields.summary: CNIS N184: SGSN-EBSM file collection is not happening ebsflow is high logging
fields.Issue Description:
******************************************************************************
Communication in advance with receiving Team is recommended. More Information - +[TR/Bug Handling Guidelines|https://web_repo-oss.seli.wh.rnd.internal.a_company.com/display/Elem_mgrJIRA/Elem_mgr+JIRA+Bug+and+JIRA+TR+Handling+Guidelines]+
******************************************************************************

Please adhere to the - +[Data Collection Guidelines|https://.a_company.com/doc_repo/erl/objectId/09004cff89533d7d?docno=1%2F03161-AOM901151Uen&action=current&format=pdf]+ for the product that you are writing this bug/TR against

******************************************************************************

*{color:#d04437}1. Detailed problem description:{color}*


Hi Team,

In CNIS N184, we could observe SGSN-EBSM file collection is not happening from 5th July and even after upgrade the file collection is still not happening and we are observing very high logging. Due to ebsflow highlogging, logtransformer pods are unhealthy and impacting diag_db updates.

{*}Reference ticket{*}: [https://project.internal.a_company.com/browse/745312]

As mentioned in the above ticket PM_MOM.xml file is having misconfiguration so, please check more on this issue which is causing high logging as well.

diag_db Link: [https://diag_dbi.athtem.eei.a_company.se/php/qplot.php?dir=250724&date=2024-07-25&oss=tor&site=LMI_cnisElem_mgr184_Elem_mgr184&tstart=2024-07-25+00%3A00%3A00&tend=2024-07-25+23%3A59%3A59&id=2288&action=jsplot]

[https://diag_dbi.athtem.eei.a_company.se/php/qplot.php?dir=250724&date=2024-07-25&oss=tor&site=LMI_cnisElem_mgr184_Elem_mgr184&id=2290&action=jsplot&tstart=2024-07-25+00%3A00%3A00&tend=2024-07-25+23%3A59%3A59&aggtype=0&aggint=1]

Logs are present in below path of client vm:
{code:java}
cElem_mgrbuild@seliius38326:~/tmp/July_26$ ls -lrth
total 0
drwxr-xr-x 5 cElem_mgrbuild eusers 249 Jul 26 12:28 ebstopology
drwxr-xr-x 5 cElem_mgrbuild eusers 261 Jul 26 12:29 ebscontroller
cElem_mgrbuild@seliius38326:~/tmp/July_26$ pwd
/home/cElem_mgrbuild/tmp/July_26  {code}
Server details: [https://eteamspace.internal.a_company.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2032790565]

Could you please check and let us know if anything required.

Regards
Sailakshmi

*{color:#d04437}2. Expected behaviour or results:{color}*
 
SGSN-EBSM file collection should be collect and no ebsflow highlogging.

*{color:#d04437}3. Activity and/or conditions during which this bug was found:{color}*

During load monitoring

*{color:#d04437}4. Tester impact :{color}*
 
load impact

*{color:#d04437}5. Potential Customer and/or System impact :{color}* 
 
System load impacting

*{color:#d04437}6. Frequency of Fault{color}*

Always

*{color:#d04437}7. Troubleshooting completed:{color}*

A support ticket on striders were created and concluded the issue is due to the PM_MOM file corruption. 
[https://project.internal.a_company.com/browse/745312?focusedId=34284213&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-34284213] 
*{color:#d04437}8. Documentation:{color}*

Relevant document(s) and revision(s) used

fields.summary: Add Node GUI behavior for usage of LDAP Credentials
fields.Issue Description:
1&;&; T R O U B L E&;&; E F F E C T


1.1. Technical problem and/or commercial effect
-
While adding a node via Add Node GUI the ldap credentials are not enabled by default and we need to manually enable it from command line via the secadm command.
This is an expected behaviour as the Add Node GUI does not have any inherent ldap server present however it is not documented anywhere in CPI.
So this TR aims to get this behaviour documented.
-
1.2. System impact
-
The customer needs to add manually enable the ldap user whenever they are adding a node via Add Node GUI

-
1.3. Conditions
-
The behaviour is reproducible whenever we add a node via the Add Node GUI
After filling up the mandatory fileds in Add Node GUI Wizard when the node is added, by default the ldapApplicationUser is disabled and the customer need to update and enable the user manually via CM CLI.

2 T R O U B L E D E S C R I P T I O N
-
2.1. Found in version
-
This is an expected behaviour and is found in all Elem_mgr Versions
The Aim of this TR is to get this behaviour documented in CPI as currently documentation of this is missing.

Customer Elem_mgr Version: 23.16 (2.32.143) AOM 901 151 R1GL/3


-
2.2. Service Management System Customer Service Request Id (SMS CSR Id)
-
CSR:-STA-00312412

-
2.3. Service Steps to Reproduce Fault (Mandatory)
-
The behaviour is reproducible whenever we add a node via the Add Node GUI
After filling up the mandatory fields in Add Node GUI Wizard when the node is added, by default the ldapApplicationUser is disabled and the customer need to update and enable the user manually via CM CLI.


-
2.4. Customer information
-
Optus Infrastructure AU


-
2.5. Configuration data
-
Faulty CRA:-Cross Domain Provisioning Subsystem (CRA 119 2183)
Faulty CNA:-Add Node (CNA 403 3439)

-
2.6. Tracing and log files
-
No Log files needed.
It is an expected behaviour and this TR aims to get this behaviour documeted in CPI.


-
2.7. Frequency of fault
-

Whenever we add a node via Add Node GUI

-
3 M E A S U R E S

3.1. Recovery

NA
-
3.2. Workaround
-
NA

&;
fields.Impact: Due to the misalignment in behavior for NetworkElementSecurity MO for a Node added via UI with that of a Node added via CLI, the Operator needs to manually intervene and update the NetworkElementSecurity from CLI for Nodes added via Add Node UI. This is an additional activity for operator in creating Node in Elem_mgr when using Add Node UI application.

fields.summary: EBS-L and EBS-N Data not generating for all Nodes activated in EBS subscriptions even after 2 TR and HOT EC loads
fields.Issue Description:
1 &; T R O U B L E &; E F F E C T





1.1. Technical problem and/or commercial effect



EBS Streaming VP stops osscounterfile generation for both LTE and NR data.



In the past we have raised two TRs for the same customer where EBS data was impacted.&;



1. CSR STA-00137811 &;/ &;JIRA raised: 679621 &;



EBS-L and EBS-N data not generated for all nodes, either EBSL data or EBSN data being received.&;



This lead to a BUG for Mixed Mode handling not proper in Elem_mgr: TR IA59755/JIRA 684639



2. CSR: STA-00137811 / JIRA raised: 688391 &;



EBS-L and EBS-N data completely stopped

&;

This went for 6 months almost and in mid March we raised TR: IA80147 / JIRA 718216.



PDU has delivered HOT EC for both TRs and Customer has loaded both HOT EC in their production server. After EC loading, we observed that still EBS data are

not being generated for all nodes by Elem_mgr. EBSL files are missing for around 1500 nodes & 800 nodes for EBSN.



We checked streaming logs and could see errors like Cannot find GNodeBId field for the event.



2024-06-06 16:50:17,393 |stream_in_nioeventloopgroup_2_4 |ERROR | GPBEventDecoderHandler &; &; &; &; &; &; &;| Error seen while decoding event: Cannot find GNodeBId field for event_id: "8". This event will not be processed.&;

&;2024-06-06 16:50:17,415 |stream_in_nioeventloopgroup_1_4 |ERROR | GPBEventDecoderHandler &; &; &; &; &; &; &;| Error seen while decoding event: Cannot find GNodeBId field for event_id: "8". This event will not be processed.

2024-06-06 17:08:01,373 |stream_in_nioeventloopgroup_4_4 |ERROR | GPBEventDecoderHandler &; &; &; &; &; &; &;| Error seen while decoding event: Cannot find GNodeBId field for event_id: "8". This event will not be processed.

2024-06-06 19:21:09,637 |stream_in_nioeventloopgroup_3_4 |ERROR | GPBEventDecoderHandler &; &; &; &; &; &; &;| Error seen while decoding event: Cannot find GNodeBId field for event_id: "8". This event will not be processed.



&;

EBS issues are running from last nine months and still files for all nodes included in EBS-L and EBS-N subscription not generating.



-

1.2. System impact

-

osscounter files are not available in Elem_mgr for EBSN & EBSL so pm reports are impacted.





1.3. Conditions

-

Daily



2 &; T R O U B L E &; D E S C R I P T I O N



-

2.1. Found in version

-

23.16 (2.32.143) AOM 901 151 R1GL/3



-

2.2. Service Management System Customer Service Request Id (SMS CSR Id)

-

STA-00129958



-

2.3. Steps to Reproduce Fault (Mandatory)



-



Y( Activate EBSN & EBSL subscription in Elem_mgr )



-

2.4. Customer information



Optus Australia



-

2.5. Configuration data

-



N/A



-

2.6. Tracing and log files&;

-

Logs attached in FTP server



-

2.7. Frequency of fault

-

Always





3 &; M E A S U R E S



-

3.1. Recovery

-

N/A



-

3.2. Workaround

-



No

fields.summary: The GeometricPoint MO (under NetworkElement MO) is not created for a Node being discovered.
fields.Issue Description:
******************************************************************************
Communication in advance with receiving Team is recommended. More Information - +[TR/Bug Handling Guidelines|https://web_repo-oss.seli.wh.rnd.internal.a_company.com/display/Elem_mgrJIRA/Elem_mgr+JIRA+Bug+and+JIRA+TR+Handling+Guidelines]+
******************************************************************************

Please adhere to the - +[Data Collection Guidelines|https://.a_company.com/doc_repo/erl/objectId/09004cff89533d7d?docno=1%2F03161-AOM901151Uen&action=current&format=pdf]+  for the product that you are writing this bug/TR against

******************************************************************************
*{color:#d04437}1. Detailed problem description:{color}*


The Network Viewer does not display nodes on the map even though the geographic coordinates associated with the node are part of the database. The nodes have been previously set to have a geographic position, and when adding the nodes to the Elem_mgr, they are successfully synchronized with the Elem_mgr.
{code:java}
FDN : "MeContext=ML66-10-41-99-206,ManagedElement=ML66-10-41-99-206,SystemFunctions=1,SysM=1,BasicNeData=1"
alarmFilterTime : 5
backupConfigChangedTimer : 900
basicNeDataId : "1"
configChangedFromLastBackup : CONFIGCHANGED
dcnHostMtuRouted : 0
dcnMode : VLAN
dcnVrfName : <empty>
elevation : "0.0"
enablePowerRedundancy : DISABLE
latitude : "47.33969"
legalNotice : <empty>
longitude : "18.8855"
neContact : "ejzslsz"
neDescription : "MINI-LINK 6600"
neLocation : "CAB49"
neName : "ML66-10-41-99-206"
neNotes : "You can add information in this Description field that will be included in the Node Report, for example additional notes for troubleshooting or archiving purposes. Max allowed numbers of characters in this Description field is 800."
neRestartReason : NPU_COLD_MGMT
neRestartScheduledCommands : WARMRESTART
neRestartScheduledEnable : DISABLE
neRestartScheduledTime : <empty>
pmStartTime : "00:00:00"
telecomStandard : ETSI{code}
However, when a node is placed on a map (Set Location), the set coordinate is written out to the node.

If the node placement is done with a node software version where the feature was not yet supported and the node is upgraded later, the data will not be written from Elem_mgr to the node.

*{color:#d04437}2. Expected behaviour or results:{color}*


The following operation would be desirable:
 # if the geographic position in the node is different from the default (Lat 0, Long 0, Elev 0), then the data read out from the node should be used in the Network Viewer
 # if the Elem_mgr has a geographic position stored and the node does not (e.g. for the reason above), then the data stored in the Elem_mgr should be written out to the node
 # if there is a discrepancy between the two data:

 * the user has modified the coordinates in the Elem_mgr and the node is unreachable, the Elem_mgr shall update the coordinates when the node becomes available again (assuming that the configuration file sequence number on the node remains the same as when the node was last synchronized with the Elem_mgr).
 * the user has modified the coordinates in the Node GUI. In this case, the sequence number of the configuration file has been increased and Elem_mgr will perform a full CM synchronization and shall update the coordinates from the node.

We have looked at the Jira ticket [https://project.internal.a_company.com/browse/501211] and believe that storing two different sets of values for the same purpose is not the best solution.

 

*{color:#d04437}3. Activity and/or conditions during which this bug was found:{color}*

Regression test and feedback from "Microwave Knowledge Sharing Community" mailing list

*{color:#d04437}4. Tester impact :{color}*


*{color:#d04437}5. Potential Customer and/or System impact :{color}*


It is difficult to understand from the customers' point of view, but there is no clear link between the node and the management system for the same data.

*{color:#d04437}6. Frequency of Fault{color}*

Always.

*{color:#d04437}7. Troubleshooting completed:{color}*


 

*{color:#d04437}8. Documentation:{color}*

[730386] Network Viewer does not display nodes on the map even though the geographic coordinates are part of the database - project (a_company.com)
fields.Impact: Without geographic point Network Viewer does not display nodes on the map even though the geographic coordinates are part of the database.
fields.Resolution Details:
During sync while updating the latitude, longitude and elevation attributes of BasicNeData MO, we need to check if the GeographicLocation MO  and GeometricPoint MO exists or not.

If the GeographicLocation MO  and GeometricPoint MO does not exist we need to create the MOs and align the values of latitude, longitude and elevation as same as which will be updated for the attributes under BasicNeData.

If the MOs already exist we need to align the values of latitude, longitude and elevation with the same values as those of BasicNeData values.

https://gerrit-gamma.gic.a_company.se/c/OSS/com.a_company.oss.mediation.cm.flow/mini-link-indoor-cm-flows/+/18196572

fields.summary: Elem_mgr - NCM E-LAN discovered service is Service Degrade

 # {*}{color:#d04437}Detailed problem description:{color}{*}.

There is a functional ethernet service configured on the nodes waiting to be discovered by NCM.
The ethernet E-LAN service discovery results  
Service State: Service Degrade
in case the endpoint interfaces on the node have configured 2000 MaxFrame Size (that is other than 1548).

There is already an enpoint template present in NCM having MFS = 2000 however the discovery will not use that.

 

> server details:
diag_db    [https://diag_dbElem_mgr6.athtem.eei.a_company.se/php/index.php?site=LMI_ieatElem_mgrc7b04]
VNF: 10.150.160.157
Web Link: ieatElem_mgrc7b04-8.athtem.eei.a_company.se
GUI Credentials: DETS-15142/Test@1234
VNF access:DETS-15142/Test1234

Elem_mgr 24.04 (ISO Version: 2.37.77) AOM 901 151 R1GU 

1. add 2 MINI-LINK ML66 nodes,  UNI interfaces are LAN 1/7+8/8 and 1/6/8 and these have configured 'Max frame size' = 2000
2. discover E-LAN service using Elem_mgr
3. analyze state

fields.Impact: High consumption of GC time on impexpserv application
fields.Resolution Details:
Removed Full export/Delta Filter models from ebs-topology-service-config for below MOs.

The change means EBS-N no longer needs to consume CM Notifications on queue, EbsDeltaNotificationEventChannel, for the following CUUP Link MO types:

EP_NgU
S1ULink
RpUserPlaneLink
PpControlLink

fields.summary: secserv logging excessively large malformed JSON messages
fields.Issue Description:
******************************************************************************
Communication in advance with receiving Team is recommended. More Information - +[TR/Bug Handling Guidelines|https://web_repo-oss.seli.wh.rnd.internal.a_company.com/display/Elem_mgrJIRA/Elem_mgr+JIRA+Bug+and+JIRA+TR+Handling+Guidelines]+
******************************************************************************

Please adhere to the - +[Data Collection Guidelines|https://.a_company.com/doc_repo/erl/objectId/09004cff89533d7d?docno=1%2F03161-AOM901151Uen&action=current&format=pdf]+ for the product that you are writing this bug/TR against

******************************************************************************

*{color:#d04437}1. Detailed problem description:{color}*


secserv has been observed to be sending very large (~70KB+) messages towards Log transformer (LT). Due to the large size of these logs, they are trimmed and end up as malformed JSON strings (i.e. without a matching closing bracket), which cannot be parsed by Log Transformer. As a result, these logs are not parsed by LT and never end up stored in Elasticsearch. Additionally, LT writes these messages to its own container logs, and it is the combination of the size & rate of these that is causing issues with LT in addition to incurring a higher performance cost.

I have attached an example LT log that includes the original secserv log.

These logs appear to be a long list of configuration parameters in XML format - the value of which should be clarified ideally as they come with a higher processing cost than most other logs. If there is a requirement for these logs to be kept in, perhaps they should be split up into chunks and sent in batches in order to avoid the issue entirely and ensure they are correctly handled by LT and stored by Elasticsearch.

*{color:#d04437}2. Expected behaviour or results:{color}*


In general, the expectation is for applications to avoid sending very large logs (e.g. stack traces/user or node lists) to Log Transformer in order for them to be processed adequately. The [+Java coding guidelines+|https://web_repo-oss.seli.wh.rnd.internal.a_company.com/display/Classic/Java+Coding+Guidelines] for example specify that collections should not be printed directly (Logging guidelines #11), which appears to be the case in this situation.

The value these logs bring is usually not well stated (e.g. stack traces) either, so it would be beneficial if they were removed/kept to a minimum. Crucially, since these very large secserv logs never make it to Elasticsearch, if they are absolutely required changes should be made to their size to ensure they can be processed by LT. Otherwise, they should be removed if they provide no meaningful value to users/customers.

*{color:#d04437}3. Activity and/or conditions during which this bug was found:{color}*


This issue has been observed on all cElem_mgr XL servers with load.

*{color:#d04437}4. Tester impact :{color}*


Included above.

*{color:#d04437}5. Potential Customer and/or System impact :{color}* 


As a result of these logs being malformed JSON, they are not processed by Log Transformer and will not end up being stored in Elasticsearch. Therefore, a customer would be missing whatever information they would bring.

Lastly, there is a higher cost associated with parsing these types of very large logs in LT, so removing/reducing these would net performance gains in Log Transformer as well.

*{color:#d04437}6. Frequency of Fault{color}*


This issue is always seen on loaded cElem_mgr XL servers.

*{color:#d04437}7. Troubleshooting completed:{color}*


We have done an analysis into the different SGs that are seen to be sending very large malformed JSON logs towards Log Transformer, and have identified secserv as one of the contributors to this issue, with these logs being generated daily on most XL cElem_mgr server.

*{color:#d04437}8. Documentation:{color}*


N/A

******************************************************************************

*{color:#d04437}1. Detailed problem description:{color}*


NEO4J hardening was delivered to -> 2.38.23 of 24.05

 

MTE have one RACK deployment, 1137, and performed the following sequence:

 

 

1137 upgraded from  2.38.5 -> 2.38.24

1137 upgraded from 2.38.24 -> 2.38.27

 

Then rollback failed from 2.38.27 -> 2.38.24

 

Post snap restore multiple SGs were faulted.

It could be seen that NEO4J failed to start.

 

After consulting with @Micheal Agyeyev from TEAM Fargo - he could see that there was an issue retrieving the password from Consul:

fields.Impact: Failed Rollback
fields.Resolution Details:
Issue been resolved by reverting changes in Elem_mgrInst which initially hardened Neo4j;
Hardened Neo4j SG quering VaultService for PassKey and consul for passwords for every db operation, so by reverting Elem_mgrInst Neo4j been turned back to unhardened which make Neo4j SG query SFS for Passkey and passwords instead of Vault and consul.

fields.summary: R6K nodes in unsync due to "UnknownModelException: Model has not been deployed in the system"
fields.Issue Description:
1.1. Technical problem and/or commercial effect
-
Customer had Router nodes and they noticed these nodes are continuously in unsync / pending state. After analysis we found that for most of the nodes we could see below error while parsing YANG response.


ERROR[com.a_company.oss.mediation.cm.handlers.instrumentation.Er6000SystemRecorder] (Thread-30 (ActiveMQ-client-global-threads)) Error in: com.a_company.oss.mediation.netconf.handlers.Er6000YangNetconfModelTransformerHandler ("NetworkElement=W5583-RIPR-ER-01-MKK,CmFunction=1"). Exception message: Exception trying to parse the rpc-reply received from the node. Data received despite exception
ERROR [com.a_company.oss.mediation.util.netconf.parser.NetconfStreamParser] (Thread-30 (ActiveMQ-client-global-threads)) Exception trying to parse the rpc-reply received from the node. Data received despite exception: com.a_company.oss.itpf.modeling.modelservice.exception.UnknownModelException: Model has not been deployed in the system:

We applied below procedure to have a successful sync(s) for working Router nodes.
1. Clear messages from ClusteredMediationServiceConsumerCMIP0 queue
2. Restart mscmip VMs
3. Disable CM supervision on problematic nodes
Now the mediation instances are stable and collected TRACE logs by enabling CM supervision on one problematic node.
Problematic Node: W6094-RIPR-ER-01-TIF (10.191.240.214)
Sync Performed: ~30/01/2024 09:38-39
Log Name: W6094-RIPR-ER-01-TIF.tar.gz
Working Node: W6596-RIPR-ER-01-JED (10.191.239.148)
Sync Performed: 30/01/2024 10:24
Log Name: W6596-RIPR-ER-01-JED.tar.gz
Attached YANG responses collected from node and Elem_mgr CLI commands
Customer Expectation: RCA & Nodes should be in Sync state
